_desc.NAICS_DESCRIPTION: Other Grocery and Related Products Merchant Wholesalers

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Executive Summary for Lankfrod SYSCO Food Services, LLC

DESCRIPTION OF THE FACILITY AND THE REGULATED SUBSTANCE:
Lankford SYSCO Food Services, LLC is a food distribution center located in an unincorporated area of Somerset County, Maryland appoximately 2 miles north of the corpoarte limits of Pocomoke City, Maryland.  The facility employs approximately 660 associates, approximatley 400 are based at the Pocomoke City facility while the other live and work remote from the facility.  The facility is in operation for the most part 24 hours a day, 7 days a week.

The regulated substance at the facility, covered by 40 CFR Part 68, is anhydrous ammonia.  The facility utilizes anhydrous ammonia as an integral part of its refrigeration system, which consists of several storage vessels, compressors, condensers, piping and air handling units whroughout the cooler and freezer warehouses in order to maintain proper food safety temperatures.  The toal system inventory is approximately 11, 500 pounds distributed throughout the refrigeration components.

ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION AND EMERGENCY RESPONSE POLICIES:
As a concerned member of the community, the company takes it's role as a responsible corporate citizen very seriously.  The facility is operated to protect associates, contractors, and the public from injury and illness, and to minimize environmental impact.  A company safety and wellness program stresses safe work conditions and practices.  Lankford SYSCO's policy is to imspect, maintain and operate equipment and facilites in such a manner to prevent accidents, including release of hazardous materials; and to train associates in prevention, as well as to prepare them to respond rapidly and effectively should an accident occur.

Lankford SYSCO has developed and implemented emergency response procedures and Process Safety Management (PSM) plans as a part of an overall chemical management program.  The program involves a wide-range of Senior Management personnel, includi

ng the Director of Risk Management, Facilities Engineer, Safety Director, and Maintenance Manager.  Additionally, Lankford SYSCO conducts regular safety meetings and provides a wide variety of safety and health training to it's associates.

GENERAL ACCIDENT RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM:
Lankford SYSCO maintains a Process Safety Management (PSM) Plan in accordance with OSHA 29 CFR 1910.119.  the facility maintenance personnel utilize a preventative maintenance program for all the system componenets.  As part fo the program, trained refrigeration personnel routinely inspect the refrigeration system operating parameters and conduct routine maintenance as required.

FIVE YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY:
The Lankford SYSCO facility has had no accidents involving anhydrous ammonia within the last five years.

EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM:
In the event of an emergency involving our refrigeration system, Lankford SYSCO has a well defined incident command system.  The written emergency response program includes procedures to safely evacuate the facility and minimize and/or contain the release through the activation of our fully equipped Emergency Response Team whose members are trained at the Hazardous Materials Technician or Operations levels.  Appropriate Public-Sector Emergency Responders and Local Emergency Planning Committee (LEPC) officials will also be notified in the event of a release.  The emergency response plan is routinely practiced through mock drills that are coordinated with local LEPC and fire department and the memebers of the Emergency Response team receive refresher training on a yearly basis.

As part of our Risk Management Plan (RMP), Lankford SYSCO has developed a RMP Comminications Plan.  The goals of the plan are to:

           * Educate the public on the potential risks of regulated substances used by Lankford SYSCO
           * Respond to any concerns that RMP disclosures may cause with honest fact-based communications
           * Be fully prepared to effectiv

ely respond to any accidental release scenario

PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY:
As part of Lankford SYSCO's continual improvement philosophy, our company continues to identify and update system components and techniques to ensure safety.
